Text: To be clear: the #GOPTaxBill will increase the deficit which will cannibalize support from everything we know is essential to economic growth & a strong middle class, including support for our men and women in uniform.

The #GOPTaxBill will balloon the deficit by at least $1.5 TRILLION: adding to the debt burden borne by the next generation and diminishing our ability to support the military and invest in our schools, our roads, and in scientific research.

The American ppl are clamoring for us to work together. They believe our politics is broken. They think our politics is starved of common sense & compromise, and it is. The way the #GOPTaxBill is being rammed thru is exactly why the American ppl think our politics is so broken.
From the one-sidedness with which it was drafted to the reckless haste with which it was considered – the #GOPTaxBill has failed to go through anything resembling the normal legislative process.

And that’s just the Senate bill – the House already passed their #GOPTaxScam with your wealthy friends in mind. You can pass this on to them: 6/6http://www.businessinsider.com/trump-tax-plan-rich-people-benefits-2017-11/#higher-income-taxpayers-will-get-the-largest-tax-cuts-1 …
Oh & the #GOPTaxBill also plans to repeal the estate tax. That helps the top .2% 5/6https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/16/business/economy/estate-tax.html …
#GOPTaxPlan repeals the Alternative Minimum Tax, which will save the wealthiest Americans millions. 4/6

Latest changes to the pass-through rate will help -you guessed it- “the top 1 percent of American earners” 3/6https://www.cnbc.com/2017/11/29/senate-tax-bill-will-reportedly-raise-pass-through-deduction-to-20-percent.html …
Perhaps they missed this in our hometown paper:https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/27/us/politics/senate-tax-bills-potential-hurdle-republicans.html …
Honestly, if @POTUS' friends’ lawyers haven’t figured out how the #GOPTaxPlan benefits the wealthy above everyone else, let me help: 1/6
Mr. President, if your wealthy friends don’t know about all the breaks & loopholes in the #GOPTaxBill that will benefit them, they should hire a better lawyer.
Bipartisanship & compromise are possible on tax reform. We can do a better job than this & not saddle the next generation of Americans with even larger deficits, even larger debt.
The #GOPTaxBill would even open up drilling in the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge because this tax bill wouldn’t be complete unless it helped big oil companies too. #ProtecttheArctic
Under the #GOPTaxBill, estates worth over $11 million get a tax break. Corporations get a permanent reduction in their tax rates while individual tax breaks expire after a few years. Why is that?

The GOP isn't proud of their bill. Every ind. analysis has shown it will end up raising taxes. @TaxPolicyCenter estimates 60% of middle-class families will see a tax INCREASE by the time the bill is fully implemented, while folks making >$1M will get an average tax CUT of >$40K.
Esperamos poder seguir trabajando de buena fe, como lo hemos hecho durante este último mes, con nuestros colegas republicanos en el Congreso para hacer exactamente eso.

Si el Presidente, quien ya dijo este año que ‘nuestro país necesita un buen cierre de gobierno,’ no está interesado en trabajar en la difícil agenda de fin de año, trabajaremos con aquellos republicanos que si están interesados, de la misma manera que lo hicimos en abril.

No tenemos tiempo que perder para lidiar con los problemas que confrontan a nuestro país, así que vamos a continuar negociando con los líderes republicanos que estén interesados en llegar a un acuerdo bipartidista.
En lugar de ir a la Casa Blanca para un espectáculo que no resultará en un acuerdo, le hemos pedido a los líderes McConnell y Ryan que se reúnan con nosotros esta tarde.
Dado que el Presidente no ve un acuerdo entre los demócratas y la casa blanca, creemos que el mejor plan es seguir negociando con nuestros colegas republicanos en el Congreso.

If @POTUS, who already said earlier this year that "our country needs a good shutdown," isn’t interested in addressing the difficult year end agenda, we’ll work w/ those who are. Looking fwd to continuing to work in good faith w/ our GOP colleagues in Congress to do just that.
We don’t have any time to waste in addressing the issues that confront us, so we’re going to continue to negotiate with Republican leaders who may be interested in reaching a bipartisan agreement.

Given that @POTUS doesn’t see a deal btwn Dems & the White House, we believe the best path fwd is to cont. negotiating w/ our GOP counterparts in Congress instead. Rather than going to the White House for a show meeting, we’ve asked @SenateMajLdr & @SpeakerRyan to meet this pm.

Sound familiar?

What was this person’s perverted motive? Was there any history of mental health issues?
How did this monster acquire the arsenal he used to rain down death on a crowd of innocents?  Were those guns purchased & compiled legally?
Today, we are filled with shock and horror, sadness and rage. And we are left with more questions than answers.

We need real solutions in this opioid crisis. Not CUTS to programs like #Medicaid that help the most.
In Rochester & the Finger Lakes region, in 2015, there were 119 opioid-related deaths, an increase of 110 people from 2004.
In Central New York, in 2015, there were 158 opioid-related deaths, an increase of 156 people from 2004.
In the Capital Region, in 2015, there were 106 opioid-related deaths, an increase of 96 people from 2004.
In the North Country, in 2015, there were 59 opioid-related deaths, an increase of 56 people from 2004.
In Hudson Valley, in 2015, there were 295 opioid-related deaths, an increase of 279 people from 2004.
In the Southern Tier, in 2015, there were 90 opioid-related deaths, an increase of 88 people from 2004.
In Western New York in 2015, there were 308 opioid-related deaths, an increase of 292 from 2004.

The Holocaust Expropriated Art Recovery Act is a drop of justice in an ocean of injustice – but it is our duty to give it to these families.
Our bill changes the statute of limitations to help victims & families who are just discovering the location of stolen family treasures.

Myth: There have always been high levels of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere & these changes are nothing new to worry about. #Up4Climate
FACT: #Climatechange is a long-term trend w/ high highs & low lows. There is more energy in the lower atmosphere for extreme weather events.
Myth: We just had one of the coldest winters in recent history so global warming isn’t happening. #UpforClimate
FACT: Each of the last three decades was warmer than any other decade since measurements began in the 1800s #Up4Climate
Myth: recent studies have shown that in certain places, temperatures have cooled over the past decade, so #climatechange isn’t happening.
